strengths_deep_dive: The Amoud Foundation's financial health is characterized by rapid growth and lean operations. Between 2021 and 2023, revenue grew from <cite id="15">$6.7 million to over $9.5 million</cite>, allowing for the expansion of its <cite id="7">Emergency Aid and Food Aid</cite> sectors. This growth is managed with minimal overhead; the organization maintains a <cite id="11">perfect 100/100 Leadership score</cite> while keeping <cite id="16">CEO compensation at $140,000</cite>, which is modest relative to the organization's nearly $10 million revenue stream. Furthermore, the foundation's direct service delivery model results in a <cite id="17">cost per beneficiary of approximately $11.29</cite>, demonstrating high efficiency in resource allocation for its advocacy and relief work.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1998</cite>, the Amoud Foundation is a dedicated humanitarian organization focused on uplifting vulnerable populations in East Africa, specifically within <cite id="2">Somaliland and Somalia</cite>. The organization operates with a mission to provide comprehensive support to <cite id="3">15 orphan centers and specialized schools</cite> for deaf and blind children. In the 2023 fiscal year, the foundation demonstrated significant financial scale, reporting <cite id="4">$9,535,194 in total revenue</cite>, which represents a robust <cite id="5">three-year revenue CAGR of 18.6%</cite>. The foundation maintains a highly efficient operational model, directing <cite id="6">89.3% of its expenses toward program services</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are utilized almost entirely for direct aid. Beyond orphan care, the foundation manages diverse initiatives including <cite id="7">Water Is Life, Emergency Aid, and Health Care programs</cite>. As a <cite id="8">zakat-eligible entity</cite>, it provides a verified pathway for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations, specifically serving the <cite id="9">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> categories of asnaf. The organization's commitment to accountability is reflected in its <cite id="10">overall score of 88.88.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, supported by a <cite id="11">perfect leadership score of 100</cite>.
